thread.title: Oscars 2017: Emma Roberts and Michelle Williams match | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Oscars 2017: Emma Roberts and Michelle Williams match | Daily Mail Online

author: Justin Enriquez For Dailymail.Com
title: Oscars 2017: Emma Roberts and Michelle Williams match | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Michelle Williams is not just competing for the Actress in the Supporting Role prize. But she is also up against Emma Roberts when it came to who wore a low-cut monochrome number better. The two talented actresses wore very similar gowns as they hit the red carpet of the 89th Annual Academy Awards on Sunday. Scroll down for video Stunning: Michelle Williams (left) and Emma Roberts donned very similar dresses as they hit the red carpet of the 89th Annual Academy Awards on Sunday Michelle and Emma happened to wear low-cut designer dresses featuring black tops and white skirting at the event held at the Dolby Theater in Hollywood . The 36-year-old Oscar-nominated actress looked absolutely gorgeous in a low-cut Louis Vuitton dress. Michelle combed her platinum blonde pixie-cut to the side as she let her natural looks show with minimal make-up on her face. Chic: Michelle, 36, looked absolutely gorgeous in a low-cut Louis Vuitton dress Perfection: Michelle combed her platinum blonde pixie-cut to the side as she let her natural looks show with minimal make-up on her face BFFs: She was even joined by her good friend Busy Philipps as they posed for a few snaps Beaming: The two longtime friends shared a laugh on the red carpet She was even joined by her good friend Busy Philipps as they posed for a few snaps on the red carpet. Michelle faces tough competition in her fourth nomination as she is up against Naomie Harris, Nicole Kidman, Octavia Spencer and favorite Viola Davis. Emma, 26, looked ever the vintage vixen as she wore an old Armani Prive gown. The classic high-fashion number showed off plenty of cleavage as the black top was very low-cut. Gorgeous: The 26-year-old actress looked ever the vintage vixen as she wore an old Armani Prive gown at the event held at the Dolby Theater in Hollywood Demanding attention: The classic high-fashion number showed off plenty of cleavage as the black top was very low-cut Pretty: Her signature red locks were worn down flowing over her shoulders as she accentuated her porcelain skin with complimentary make-up topped off with a swipe of bright red lip There was definitely an elegant contrast to the retro number as it included a long flowy white lace skirting. She accessorized with very long dangling diamond earrings, blinged out rings and a silver clutch. Her signature red locks were worn down flowing over her shoulders as she accentuated her porcelain skin with complimentary make-up topped off with a swipe of bright red lip. Emma was not only wearing the dress to look old school cool but also for the organization Red Carpet Green Dress. On-the-move: There was definitely an elegant contrast to the retro number as it included a long flowy white lace skirting Wow factor: She accessorized with very long dangling diamond earrings, blinged out rings and a silver clutch The group has the mission of bringing awareness to sustainable fashion. Just a day prior, the Scream Queens star enjoyed some relaxation before the hustle and bustle of Hollywood's biggest night. She took to Instagram to share a photo of herself reading Chelea Girls: A Novem written by Eileen Myles while holding onto a cup from Dunkin Donuts. Emma captioned the image to her near 10 million followers: 'Reading + Fueling for tomorrow with my @DunkinDonuts Americano #RedCarpetReady #AwardShowPrep #Ad.' Chill: Just the day before she took to Instagram to share a photo of herself reading Chelea Girls: A Novem written by Eileen Myles while holding onto a cup from Dunkin Donuts 89TH ACADEMY AWARDS NOMINEES MOTION PICTURE OF THE YEAR Arrival
